Body: Possible Duplicate:  How can I circumvent regional restrictions in the Android Market?  I'd like to install an app from the Market which is limited to the USA (specifically Google Music). When I search for the app myself in the Market app on my phone, it does not find the app; it seems to be filtered.So how do I install apps which are not meant for my country?
Title: How to install apps which are targeted for another country?

history.Text: I have an HTC Desire. have rooted it and installed cyanogenmod 7.0.3 because of the lack of available internal memory with the stock 2.2 android rom. The cyanogenmod rom has 2.3.3 android.I'd like to install an app from the market which is bound to the USAhttps://market.android.com/details?id=com.google.android.music But can't install it with the above link, because it is not compatible with the country selected for my device. When I search for the app myself on the market app on my phone, it does not find the app. (seems to be filtered)So how do I install apps which are not meant for my country?
How to install apps which are targetted for another country?

history.Comment: deleted 275 characters in body; edited tags; edited title
history.Text: I'd like to install an app from the Market which is limited to the USA (specifically [Google Music](https://market.android.com/details?id=com.google.android.music)). When I search for the app myself in the Market app on my phone, it does not find the app; it seems to be filtered.So how do I install apps which are not meant for my country?

When I search for the app myself in the Market app on my phone, it does not find the app; it seems to be filtered.So how do I install apps which are not meant for my country?
